dataset.title: Stream water chemistry data for Saddle stream (007), 1994 - ongoing.
dataset.abstract: This is a summary of major ion concentrations for stream water samples collected at the outflow of the Saddle stream, near Saddle grid point 007 on Niwot Ridge.

intellectualRights.para: This information is released under the Creative Commons license - Attribution - CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). The consumer of these data (“Data User” herein) is required to cite it appropriately in any publication that results from its use. The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is." The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Sampling location was the outflow of the Saddle stream near Saddle grid point 007.

maintenance.description: This data set was compiledby Hope Humphries from data provided by the Kiowa lab manager.[HCH 26 December 2015] LTER_site column was added.[HCH 25 April 2018]. The data was edited to change all dns to DNS, changed pH units to 'pH' from 'none' [ATW 04 January 2018]Niwot metadata converted via script to EML[SCE 2019-01-04] . Data for 2014-2018 were supplied by B. Bednarek and appended [ATW 29 Aug 2019]. Data for 2019 appended, samp_loc column name was changed to local_site to match other water chem datasets [ATW 16 Feb 2021]. Data for 2020 appended [ATW 10 March 2021].

description.para: The Saddle stream is an ephemeral stream that drains the Saddle experiment area on Niwot Ridge; this catchment area is ~8 ha. Vegetation is alpine tundra; soils are Cryochrepts developed in a 2 m thick diamicton of granitic parent material. Surface waters were collected as grab samples at daily to weekly sampling frequency at the outflow of Saddle stream, which is near the Saddle grid point designated 007. Water samples were collected in polyethylene bottles (following the protocol of Campbell et al. 2000), soaked with deionized water overnight, and then rinsed copiously five times; bottles were further rinsed three times with sample water at the time of collection. Samples were collected ~10 cm below the water surface in turbulent areas where the water column was well mixed. All water samples were transported the same day as collection to our wet chemistry laboratory (Kiowa lab) and treated the same as melted snow samples. Samples for dissolved organic carbon (DOC) were collected using precombusted, amber-colored glass bottles with Teflon-lined caps. All analyses were conducted at the Kiowa lab.
Data were provided by the Kiowa lab manager as Excel spreadsheets.
The charge balance was calculated as (cation sum - anion sum)/(cation sum + anion sum).
The missing value indicator is one of the following codes:
Concentrations below the detection limit are shown as zero prior to 2007 and "u" subsequently.
No samples were collected in 2001 and 2002 because of insufficient stream flow.
The following variables were not measured, but were included for consistency with other data sets:
acidity, alkalinity, tritium, and standard deviation of tritium

project.title: The Niwot Ridge Long-Term Ecological Research Program 2011-2016: Tipping Points in High-Elevation Ecosystems in Response to Changes in Climate and Atmospheric Deposition

dataTable.entityDescription: Stream water chemistry data for Saddle stream (007), 1994 - ongoing at Niwot Ridge LTER site

attribute.attributeDefinition: standard deviation delta Deuterium; NP-not performed

unit.name: microsiemensPerCentimeter
unit.description: microsiemens per centimeter; used for concentration of ionized dissoved solids

unit.name: microequivalentPerLiter
unit.description: concentration of charge (on dissolved ions). A single ultiplier to SI is not possible; since conversion includes valence of ion; which can vary

unit.name: micromolePerLiter
unit.description: commonly used for concentration of some chemical constituents of natural water bodies; e.g.; nutrients. It has the same magnitude as micromolar; but micromolar can only be used for a dissolved constituent

unit.name: partsPerThousand
unit.description: ratio of two quantities as parts per thousand (1:1000)

unit.name: tritiumUnit
unit.description: Tritium unit; 1 tritium unit= 3.22 picocuries per liter

unit.name: milligramPerLiter
unit.description: concentration unit; sometimes used for pigments in natural waters
